Package com.anyicomplex.xdg.utils

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    XDGDesktopIcon
    The xdg-desktop-icon program can be used to install an
    application launcher or other file on the desktop of the
    current user.
    XDGDesktopIcon.Option
    All available options.
    XDGDesktopIcon.Subcommand
    All available subcommands.
    XDGDesktopMenu
    The xdg-desktop-menu program can be used to install new menu
    entries to the desktop's application menu.
    XDGDesktopMenu.Option
    All available options.
    XDGDesktopMenu.Subcommand
    All available subcommands.
    XDGEmail
    xdg-email opens the user's preferred e-mail composer in order
    to send a mail to address(es) or mailto-uri.
    XDGEmail.Option
    All available options.
    XDGIconResource
    The xdg-icon-resource program can be used to install icon
    resources into the desktop icon system in order to illustrate
    menu entries, to depict desktop icons or to graphically
    represent file types.
    XDGIconResource.Option
    All available options.
    XDGIconResource.Subcommand
    All available subcommands.
    XDGMime
    The xdg-mime program can be used to query information about
    file types and to add descriptions for new file types.
    XDGMime.Option
    All available options.
    XDGMime.Subcommand
    All available subcommands.
    XDGOpen
    xdg-open opens a file or URL in the user's preferred
    application.
    XDGScreenSaver
    xdg-screensaver provides commands to control the screensaver.
    XDGScreenSaver.Subcommand
    All available subcommands.
    XDGSettings
    xdg-settings gets various settings from the desktop
    environment.
    XDGSettings.Option
    All available options.
    XDGSettings.Subcommand
    All available subcommands.
    XDGUtils
    xdg-utils is a set of tools that allows applications to easily integrate with the desktop environment of the user, regardless of the specific desktop environment that the user runs.
    XDGUtils.ExitCode
    An exit code of 0 indicates success while a non-zero exit code
    indicates failure.
    XDGUtils.Mode
    mode can be user or system.
